fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35656].
  {panel}

Here is an extremely common use case that is not covered properly by JIRA or Confluence user picket fields:
If you copy the email contact from an email client, like Microsoft Outlook, you will end-up with something like this in the clipboard: "John Doe <john.doe@acme.com>"
If you paste this value in the user picker, it will not find you the contact even if the username and the email address do both match perfectly.
If you paste only email address or only username it does work, but the entire idea is to make it work without having to edit the text.
I would even see it as an acceptable use to search only by email address if you paste a text formatted like the one above. The test above is the default format for email addresses, as in mail RFCs.
Think about this, is a minor code change that would increase user experience considerably.
fields.summary: Confluence user picker does not properly recognise email addresses with names

fields.description:
When trying to add a JIRA Gadget to a Confluence page (see https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Adding+JIRA+Gadgets+to+a+Confluence+Page) and that gadget has "url" as a parameter, the gadget will not be displayed.

Editing the macro, Confluence shows the error message, that the gadget with the URL that was specified as the plugin's "url" parameter was not registered with Confluence.

This was noticed in the Custom Content for JIRA plugin version 0.3 (https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.tngtech.jira.plugins.customcontent.jira-gadget-custom-content). Renaming the parameter fixed the issue.

fields.description:
Non-standard characters in the home page template cause problems for Theme Press (it blows up when trying to render the home page).

This can be tested in out-of-the-box Confluence by creating a documentation space using the blueprint, click the Edit button on the home page, click the Save button (without making any changes--this creates a new version with the weird characters removed). Then using Page History, try to revert the page to version 1 (which results in a stack trace in the browser).

The characters are shown in the accompanying screenshot (TextMate shows the strange characters), which if converted to regular spaces (or  ) seems to fix everything. There are eight total, two in each task body, surrounding the hyphens.

This occurs in confluence-space-blueprints-1.5.2.jar

I've marked this as critical because it causes a stack trace whenever the Documentation space blueprint is used with Theme Press (if you're curious, the special characters cause the:

{code}
xhtmlContent.replaceMacroDefinitionsWithString(storageFormat, context, new MacroDefinitionReplacer()...
{code}

method invocation to fail spectacularly.
fields.summary: Non-standard characters on Documentation space blueprint home page breaks Brikit Theme Press

fields.description:
I attempted an installation twice on our server and both times the service was unable to correctly start.  I realized that this was related to an existing service on port 8000.

In the installer, I established port 8090 as the control port and 8001 as the hosted port.  The server.xml file had the correct control port but the wrong hosted port.

I attached screenshots.  I did a re-install with different port #s and this issue persisted.  I could not get the service to start.  Once I changed the server port manually to 8001, the service was able to start fine and it all works now.  I lost a few hours of work due to this, as the Stash system did not have this error.
fields.summary: Windows x64 installer for Confluence 5.6.3 ignores Http Port Number

fields.description:
But this was perfectly possible before. Of course you still can modify the distributed setenv.sh file but that is definitely not very nice and does not make deploying a new version any easier.

In 5.5 and previous, setenv.sh reads

{code}
JAVA_OPTS="-Xms256m -Xmx512m -XX:MaxPermSize=256m $JAVA_OPTS -Djava.awt.headless=true "
export JAVA_OPTS
{code}

So this allows to override any default settings by supplying a previous JAVA_OPTS, no changes to the script required.

However now in 5.6

{code}
# Set the JVM arguments used to start Confluence. For a description of the options, see
# http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/tech/vmoptions-jsp-140102.html
CATALINA_OPTS="$CATALINA_OPTS -Xms1024m -Xmx1024m -XX:MaxPermSize=256m -XX:+UseG1GC"
CATALINA_OPTS="$CATALINA_OPTS -Djava.awt.headless=true"
CATALINA_OPTS="$CATALINA_OPTS -Xloggc:$LOGBASEABS/logs/gc-`date +%F_%T`.log -XX:+UseGCLogFileRotation -XX:NumberOfGCLogFiles=5 -XX:GCLogFileSize=2M"
CATALINA_OPTS="$CATALINA_OPTS -XX:-PrintGCDetails -XX:+PrintGCTimeStamps -XX:-PrintTenuringDistribution"
export CATALINA_OPTS
{code}

It is impossible to override any default settings already specified, as anything one could set in CATALINA_OPTS is followed by the default options. Not good.

Please do move the default CATALINA_OPTS to the end, so they can effectively override default values.
fields.summary: From Confluence 5.6 onwards it is not possible to override JVM settings via environment variables

fields.description:
If you install a Confluence on 5 series and choose the option, "Restore Data" under the upload and restore session you will see the following message:
!img.PNG|thumbnail!

By that message our customers can assume that confluence in 5 series can handle imports from older version like 4.3 for instance.

The problem with that is that we *do not support* that approach as mentioned in below page Backward version compatibility section:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Restoring+a+Site
(i) We clearly state that when we say *Importing an old XML backup file to a new major version (for example, Confluence 3.5 to Confluence 4.0) is not supported*.

This scenario could cause problems if a customer do a emergency restore using a xmlbackup and then only later find out problems on his instance doing this incorrect version import.
fields.summary: Confluence Restore Data Page is showing misleading information

fields.description:
When using the installer (bin) to upgrade Confluence on Linux, the installer does not keep the port number from the older version, setting it to the default 8090 again.

Documentation says:
{quote}
During the upgrade the wizard will migrate following from your existing Confluence installation:

TCP port values in your server.xml file. 
{quote}

h3.Steps to reproduce
# Install a Confluence 5.0.3, for example
# Modify its port number on _<confluence-install-folder>/conf/server.xml_ to use 8099, for example.
# Download Confluence 5.6.4 bin installer for Linux
# Run it and select the _Upgrade_ option, pointing it to the 5.0.3 version you've just installed.
# Once the upgrade is done, the installer prints a message like the following one:
{{Confluence 5.6.4 can be accessed at http://localhost:8099}}
#* However, if we check its server.xml file under _<confluence-install-folder>/conf/server.xml_, we'll see that the port number got updated to 8090 instead of keeping the 8099 one.

h3.Workaround
Stop the Confluence instance and set the port number on _<confluence-install-folder>/conf/server.xml_ again.
fields.summary: Confluence installer does not keep the port settings when upgrading

This can take a while to download JS and turn itself into a comment editor.  if you type then the page keyboard short cuts are still active and all hell breaks loose

Expected Behaviour

Click on comment area
UI says its turning into an editor
Start typing "Welcome to"
The editor comes up and for bonus points the text "Welcome to" is there
Sweet experience had

Actual Behaviour

Click on comment area
UI says its turning into an editor
Start typing "Welcome to"
Keyboard short cuts still active
e in Welcome starts a page edit
c in Welcome pops a page create
Much angst and loss of sweet experience
fields.summary: Clicking on edit comment does not stop keyboard shortcuts

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35555].
  {panel}

h5.Environment: 
Confluence 5.4.3, Confluence 5.4.4
JIRA 6.3.7

h5.Steps to reproduce
# Create an application link between JIRA and Confluence
# In JIRA, create a scrum project, that has at least one epic in it.
# In Confluence, create a page with the "Page Properties Macro".
# Give this page a label of "Report"
# Insert a table with one row, one heading column and one body column. Set the header to "Epic" and insert a JIRA link to the epic you created.
# Duplicate this page 25-30 times
# Create a new page, and insert the "Page Properties Report" macro
## Enter "report" as the label
## Enter "epic" as a field to be displayed
## Save the report page and refresh

h5.Expected Results
The page should be displayed as quickly since issues from JIRA should be batched (as per https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-31899)

Displaying lots of JIRA issues on a page isn't a problem - a dozen or so issues on a single macro, displayed 3-4 times on a single page loads almost instantly.

h5.Actual Results
The page properties report macro can take a noticeably longer period of time to load. The performance problem can be exacerbated by higher usage in a production environment.

h5.Workaround
Remove any fields containing a JIRA macro from the page properties report macro. This will at least return performance to normal.

Additionally, performance appears to be a little better in newer versions of Confluence, but can still be a problem in a loaded production environment.
fields.summary: Poor performance in JIRA isssues macro when used in conjunction with a page properties report

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35553].
  {panel}

When exporting a space (it doesn't matter if it's XML, HTML or PDF exports), after the space export is finished, below the completion bar should have a "here" with a link after the "Download", however it's missing on Internet Explorer 11.
Check screenshot.

*Workaround:*
- Go to {{<Confluence Installation>/confluence/admin/longrunningtask-common.vm}} and find this line 
{{return response.getElementsByTagName(tagName)[0].firstChild.data;}} and replace it with {{return response.getElementsByTagName(tagName)[0].textContent;}}

OR
- Use another browser, since this still works on Firefox, Chrome and Safari.

OR
- Using IE 11 in compatibility mode and change the compatibility mode to IE 9 when exporting the space. The download link will appear if set to IE 9 compatibility mode.

[View this link on how to change the compatibility mode and compatibility version in developer mode|http://kb.mit.edu/confluence/display/istcontrib/How+to+change+your+setting+for+Compatibility+mode+for+Internet+Explorer#HowtochangeyoursettingforCompatibilitymodeforInternetExplorer-UseDeveloperToolstochangeIECompatibilitymodeversion]
fields.summary: Can't download exported space from IE11

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35540].
  {panel}

Reproducible using Chrome 38 and Confluence 5.6.3.

When you use the browser "back" button to return to the Export PDF Options page after doing a custom export of selected pages, it remembers that you had selected "Custom Export" but the page selector is reset to the default of "all pages" and the page selection is not displayed. (see [^back to export pdf options.png]) A user may then click on the Export button, either in an attempt to get the page list to be displayed, or on the assumption that the same page selection will be used as last time. This triggers an accidental full space export which consumes resources needlessly. 

Workaround is to click on Custom Export or change the export type to Normal Export and then back to Custom, so that the page selection is displayed and the user can set the pages to export (again).

Note that the behaviour is different with Firefox 31 ESR. In that case when you go "back" to the Export PDF Options page after doing a custom export of selected pages, *all* selections are reset to initial values. This means that the type is set back to Normal Export. It's not nice that the user's settings have been forgotten, but at least they are all forgotten consistently and it's unlikely that the user will be confused about what will happen when they click Export. 

What would really be nice is if the tool remembered *all* the export settings (export type and selected pages) so that a user could easily redo the same export. One of our users discovered this problem when they did a custom export, checked the results, discovered a problem, fixed it on the Confluence page, and then tried to go "back" to redo the same export.
fields.summary: Export PDF options behaviour can lead to accidentally triggering a full space export

fields.summary: Exception clicking Application Links
Images Missing on our intranet instance

fields.description:
After a HTML export from a page images are missing (broken link symbol in HTML page) under following circumstances:

* The image contains a "+" sign or a space (" ") in its name *and*
* the image is not attached to the page itself, but is referenced from the exported page but is attached to another page (not being exported)

* Please also note that images containing a "#" character in their file name are *never* exported to HTML, even if they are attached to the exported page itself.

We are using the default "Space export" functionality, not any 3rd party plugin.

See the  attached screenshot: This is a HTML page exported from confluence. The upper image was named "Warnmeldung Wasserrecht.png", the lower simply "Warnmeldung.png". *Both* images were attached to a different page not included in export. The lower one appears correctly, the upper one doesn't.
The missing image is actually missing from the "attachments" subfolder in the created HMTL.zip file, that's why it cannot be shown.

I was able to create a test case within 5 minutes, so this should be easy to reproduce.

The only "workaround" is *extremely* time consuming, because it basically means to re-organize and rename many of the images of every page and rework the pages accordingly. Hardly a solution for a whole space. I therefore consider a true fix for this absolutely necessary.

----
Note: Together with bug CONF-31714 this renders Confluence rather useless for creating (software) documentation which needs to be exported, at least in our case where we use (and re-use) lots of images on the pages. This bug has cost us 5hrs already + 1hr for the bug report.
fields.summary: HTML export: Images with certain characters and from different pages missing

fields.description: The task report is not complete: Confluence version 5.5.6 generates one page with the maximum number or records as specified in the application, which is 40. If there are more than 40 tasks, Confluence does not extend the report to a further page length but just reports the firs 40 tasks as defined in the sorting criteria. So, for example, if there are 150 tasks, only the first 40 are reported, the next 41-150 are not visible and they can be found only if someone knows in which pages they have been recorded. This makes the macro unusable, as it can not create a full task report. In the last example, the macro should generate a page of 150 records, consisting of 3 parts with 40 records each and a forth part with the remaining 30 records.

Workflow Designer doesn't work after migrating from OnDemand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35521].
  {panel}

I find it odd that the macros such as panel-macro does not have a colour picker.
Not all confluence users are techie users that know what html colour codes are or how to install browser plugins like colorzilla.

If confluence is to be used outside the IT-world then such a feature is essential.

Any hope for a built-in colour-picker in the macros in a future release?

Excel macro configuration:
<ac:macro ac:name="viewxls">
<ac:parameter ac:name="name">spreadsheet name.xlsx</ac:parameter>
      <ac:parameter ac:name="sheet">worksheet name</ac:parameter>
 </ac:macro>

Using the Excel Macro to display an Excel spreadsheet will cause the comments section (usually at the bottom of the page) to float at a fixed point  (in relation to your browser) almost at the top of the screen. 
(See with-commenting.png)

This problem apears only on the page with the Excel Macro, and will disapear as soon as the macro is removed (even though the actual spreadsheet is still attached to the page).

Disabling comments on the whole space will relieve a part of the problem (the problem being a floating comments section in the field of view) but will not solve it, as the "labels" section (field?) is still floating in the upper right corner. (See no-commenting.png).

Regards

Emad Maroun
fields.summary: ViewExcel macro breaks comments section

fields.description:
PUT to rest/api/content/<id>/child/attachment/<attachmentid> only updates attachment metadata - it doesn't change the attachment content nor create a new version, which is correct.

However it requires that the version in the post is <currentversion+1> (it rejects <currentversion> with a 409 Conflict error), which is incorrect, since the metadata on <currentversion> is updated, and no <currentversion+1> is created.
fields.summary: AttachmentResource.update incorrectly requires version+1

fields.description:
Since Confluence 5.5.x the page update event is being triggered whenever a page that is linked to is moved within the space, for the moved page and all the pages that link to the moved page.

As far as I'm aware when a page is moved within a space the link content doesn't need to be updated?

Comparing the [5.4 version|https://docs.atlassian.com/confluence/5.4/com/atlassian/confluence/links/RelatedContentRefactorer.html] of RelatedContentRefactorer vs the [5.5.1 version|https://docs.atlassian.com/confluence/5.5.1/com/atlassian/confluence/links/RelatedContentRefactorer.html] seems to be where this problem was introduced.  In the source for _DefaultRelatedContentRefactorer_ I can't see any checks that the previous space key doesn't match the new space key before the content is updated.

(Note; as the page moved events are applied to all child pages, this issue also affects any child page of a moved page that has links to it.)

This is a significant issue for plugins that listen to the PageUpdatedEvent to trigger functionality based on pages actually being updated.
fields.summary: Page Update event is triggered for page moves within same space.

Installing the Applinks Diagnostics Plugin (5.1.0) on a version of Confluence using Applinks Product Plugin (3.10.6) causes the Application Links configuration page to render incorrectly

h3. Reproduction steps:

# Restart Confluence
# Navigate to Application Links Configuration Page

h3. Expected behavior
The Application Links configuration page should behave normally

The Application Links page shows the 3.10 interface and the newer 4.X interface, clicking {{Click here to add a new one}} does not open the AppLinks popup

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35503].
  {panel}

Per https://developer.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Space+Blueprint+Module?focusedCommentId=30614152#comment-30614152 , it would be good if a Space BP plugin developer could fix the ordering of the pages that are created in a new Space.

I see two ways that this could be done:

# Add a "position" attribute to each ContentTemplateRef, that is passed to the Page when being added to the database, OR
# Add a "childrenOrdered" flag attribute to the ContentTemplateRef for the childrens' parent page, which would calculate the correct Page position to set for each child being added to the database

The first option is good because it would generically allow content-template plugin modules to indicate their desired position in the page order, and bad for the same reason - it could be used to create pages that push their way to the top of the order, without user consent.

The second option is a little ugly because the positions of the children would be defined via the parent's configuration, yet it would give Confluence's code final say over the actual position used for each child.
fields.summary: Allow child templates in Space Blueprints to have manual ordering

fields.description:
When using the Excerpt Macro to include another Excerpt, it only works if an Excerpt from another page is included.
If we try to include an excerpt from the same page, the following error is shown on the page:
{code}
Error rendering macro 'excerpt-include' : null
{code}

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create a new page on Confluence
# Include the Excerpt Macro and write something inside it
# Save the page
# Create another page
# Include the Excerpt Macro and write something inside it
# Save the page
# Edit the same page again
# Include the Excerpt Include Macro, selecting the first page you've created
# Include another Excerpt Include Macro, selecting the same page you are editing now
# Save the page
# Access the page and see the error
fields.summary: Excerpt Macro null when including an excerpt from the same page

fields.summary: Unable to Create Page Using Blueprint after missing Title

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Authentication requests originating from a connected Service Desk portal caused by a search query by a customer user account will fail.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA 6.3.5 (or newer)
# Install latest version of SD
# Create a user on JIRA side, and remove it from all groups (to mimic a "customer")
# Install Confluence 5.5.1 (or older)
# Create a space and several pages under the space
# Set up Application links between JIRA and Confluence using 2-Legged OAuth requests and allow user impersonation through 2-Legged OAuth
# In the SD project, create a knowledge base link to the Confluence space previously created
# In a new/incognito window, log in as the customer on the SD portal
# In the SD portal, search for one of the pages created in step 5

h3. Expected Results
Confluence serves the pages fitting the query as entered in Service Desk

h3. Actual Results
Confluence blocks the authentication of the customer user from JIRA end.
The JIRA logs will show the following errors:
{code}2014-10-28 15:39:00,685 http-bio-8639-exec-14 WARN customer 939x1212x1 1wooz9p 127.0.0.1 /rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/BAG/kb/d3857cf7-a8cc-39da-b42d-a5ae13cee067/articles [apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodDirector] Unable to respond to any of these challenges: {oauth=OAuth realm="http%3A%2F%2Fbaseurl%3A6534", oauth_token="", oauth_consumer_key="jira%3A855b5049-8e45-41d0-8007-3b19d384b3e7", oauth_signature_method="RSA-SHA1", oauth_timestamp="1414507140", oauth_nonce="28253628592793", oauth_version="1.0", oauth_signature="QU%2FwHRcz3RwAoqgAdzq9Kdm1uByt7ET9FcNA%2BsA47iBQjbxIE6%2F4zVNuJ%2F6NsGBspsT1pjOt1PjqVAjggxZHTDdqdipEhk8lu0%2BWcilvW7%2B1nf7GN3T0RfUFIyYt8V7%2FMo7c1jVeLFp%2FY0VRtY1vLpkVTy%2BsjyDyqatG6J0qYqY%3D"}
2014-10-28 15:39:00,688 http-bio-8639-exec-14 WARN customer 939x1212x1 1wooz9p 127.0.0.1 /rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/BAG/kb/d3857cf7-a8cc-39da-b42d-a5ae13cee067/articles [internal.feature.applink.RestResponseHandler$] Received invalid JSON response for path /rest/knowledge-base/1.0/search?type=page&where=123&queryString=pag
2014-10-28 15:39:00,804 http-bio-8639-exec-17 WARN customer 939x1213x1 1wooz9p 127.0.0.1 /rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/BAG/kb/d3857cf7-a8cc-39da-b42d-a5ae13cee067/articles [apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodDirector] Unable to respond to any of these challenges: {oauth=OAuth realm="http%3A%2F%2Fbaseurl%3A6534", oauth_token="", oauth_consumer_key="jira%3A855b5049-8e45-41d0-8007-3b19d384b3e7", oauth_signature_method="RSA-SHA1", oauth_timestamp="1414507140", oauth_nonce="28253739552063", oauth_version="1.0", oauth_signature="JHT69%2BuIwfpJ7jnhM3nthAjC16t%2B%2FDV77O9F1kOPJdO%2BlM%2BDgYXFSajx3LrqPNmmWYKxrjOwICWeoDptWiIXa%2Fxvmkxpa%2Bv1UxZToPHWZYHyYGs9A7U22muljtcSHRgSyS9Ki8hk4E3ttpuPS%2Fbq6bWx0IPhndKoIITbPL5umZ0%3D"}
2014-10-28 15:39:00,805 http-bio-8639-exec-17 WARN customer 939x1213x1 1wooz9p 127.0.0.1 /rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/BAG/kb/d3857cf7-a8cc-39da-b42d-a5ae13cee067/articles [internal.feature.applink.RestResponseHandler$] Received invalid JSON response for path /rest/knowledge-base/1.0/search?type=page&where=123&queryString=page{code}

h3. Notes
Investigation has shown that the 
{code}confluence-knowledge-base-1.3.jar
confluence-remote-page-view-plugin-1.4.jar{code}
plugins are responsible for this. Upgrading to Confluence 5.5.2 or newer resolves this issue. 

Alternatively, you can replace the bundled plugins with the newer versions as provided as attachments to this bug report.
(!) This has been tested and confirmed to work in Confluence 5.4.3
We can however not guarantee this to provide a solution in all cases. As such, we do not support this method, and serves as an ultimate workaround in case upgrading Confluence is no option. At all times, we advice upgrading Confluence over replacing the plugin files.

(!) This error might happen on more recent Confluence releases (e.g. 5.6.4) if the {{confluence-knowledge-base-1.4.jar}} plugin fails to load and is not enabled during the startup. In such cases, a possible workaround is to manually update the add-on via [file upload on UPM|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/UPM/Installing+add-ons#Installingadd-ons-Installingbyfileupload].
fields.summary: Service Desk originating authentication requests failing

fields.description:
A search by remote API-SOAP without querystring returns 
"com.atlassian.confluence.rpc.RemoteException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: A query string must be supplied."

On Confluence UI it is simple possible to enter no searchstring, with resulting rows...

This is especially bad, if you want search only by parameters...
fields.summary: SOAP search without querystring returns "A query string must be supplied"

fields.description:
If you have a certain amount of spaces (in our case 2,180), the Space Directory Paginator will break the layout of the page, because it does not make a break after some pages.

There should be a break after ~ 10 pages in order to avoid display errors. I kindly ask you to provide a fix for our environment.
fields.summary: Space Directory Paginator is not scaling
Allow page tree macro to skip permission checks
